attributes.comment:
I am not sure if this is the right department or not, if not, please forward this
message to the correct department.

I am writing in regards to the proposed increase of fees for the USCIS for for I-600
for adoptive families.

It is detramental for adoptive families that these fees remain unchanged. First off,
the fees were recently increased not too long ago, so it wouldn't make sense to
increase them again, so soon. Also, with the cost of adoption already costing
adoptive families so much, it would be additionally hard to come up with this new
fee amount.

There are so many orphans throughout the world who need wonderful, loving
families who can care for them and provide a safe place that they can call home.
Unfortunately, due the high costs of adoption, there are many families out there
who would love to open their hearts and homes to these beautiful children, but
can't because of a lack of funds. This needs to change!

Instead, federal government departments want to raise the cost of necessary
paperwork, which puts an even bigger gap between median income families who
would love to somehow find a way to bring one of these children home. Please
don't do this!

I encourage you to keep the fees where they are. Help us bring these orphans
throughout the world to loving home they so need and deserve, by
keeping "paperwork" fees down.

Thank you!
Cammie S. Harward
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Cammie S. Harward
